column1: Household Family Structure of Childrena for the United States, by Selected Characteristics : 1990 - 2000
(For information on confidentiality protection, sampling error, nonsampling error, and definitions, see www.census.gov/prod/cen2000/doc/sf3.pdf.  See Appendix A for further definitions.)
In high-income family (income 400+ percent of poverty level)…………………………………………..
(-) Represents or rounds to zero.  (X) Not applicable.  (NS) Not significantly different from zero at the 90-percent confidence level.

Note: Children are all people under 18 years living in households except householders, subfamily reference persons, and their spouses.  Children living with no parent present are not included in this table.
a.  Determined by relationship of child to householder or reference person in a related subfamily.
b.  The percentage point change between unrounded percents in 1990 and 2000.
Source:  U.S. Census Bureau, Census 2000, Summary File 3; U.S. Bureau of the Census, 1990 census Summary Tape File 3
